result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald J Gaulin Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donald J Gaulin Sr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Donald J Gaulin Sr was found guilty of Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Donald J Gaulin Sr was found guilty of Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Each count concur.
10-20-16: Entire sentence is stayed pending appeal.
4/3/17: Court orders stay of probation lifted. Def shall receive probation credit  for 11/16/15 through 10/20/16.
3-6-18: Probation is extended for 1 year from 4-29-18 to 4-29-19, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.

miscConds.notes: Ct signed order. $1,262 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections. Any tax returns to be intercepted and applied to restitution. Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$253 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JC, PW, or CG. Not be in direct solicitation of auto repairs but may work for an auto repair shop.
File state and federal tax returns timely each year with copy to agent within 10 days of filing. Any tax returns to be intercepted and applied to restitution. Comply with all ATCP regulations.

timeConds.notes:
W/huber, consec to any other sentence def may be serving. If late to report to jail no huber privileges. Sentence stayed if restitution has been paid in full.
2-26-16: Ct grants motion to stay conditional time.
5-12-17: Ct orders jail report date changed to 7-5-17. (prev 6-2-17)
6-27-17: Ct orders report date is changed from 7-5-17 to 7-12-17.
7/12/17 Crt orders the 60 days conditional jail on ct 1 stayed pending further court order. Def serving conditional jail on ct 2 of 15CM239.

records.addlTxt: Probation is extended for 1 year from 4-29-18 to 4-29-19, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.  Amended Judgment of Conviction prepared.

Defendant in court with Attorney Vicki Zick.  Paul W. Humphrey appeared for the State of Wisconsin w/ P/P agent Maria Guerrero. Hearing set at the request from the agent because defn has not paid restitution. DOC request an extension. Defn due to discharge on April  29, 2018. Statement made by P/P agent. Argument by ADA Humphrey. State request either 60 days DCJ or an extension of probation. Argument by Atty Zick. Defn request to be discharged in April. Defn exam by CT regarding tax returns. Statement by Defn. CT makes findings and requires DOC to update the CT if defn has stopped making payments towards restitution. CT makes findings that defn has not made good faith efforts towards restitution and orders probation extended for one more year. Current termination now April 29, 2019 or terminated once defn has paid all restitution. CT signs 101 form f/w.

records.addlTxt: Parties discuss how much time left defn has to serve on probation. CT will set STC in 6 mo to see if defn made good faith effort towards restitution. If defn pays rest in full, defn's prob will be terminated. If defn failed to make good faith effort, CT will order conditional jail. CT will suspend conditional jail immediately. CT to leave 15CM238 JOC unchanged. CT orders the conditional jail in 15CM239 is permanently stayed, and defn to be released from jail f/w.
